result.execSummary:
The defendant America J. Mejia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintaining A Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: First 90 days straight time.  Remainder with huber.

Court does not object to transfer of probation to any intrastate compact state.
Court does not object to traveling out of state for work.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of appellant rights.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession  and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court grants expungement after completion of probation.
Maintain absolute sobriety with randon drug testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. America J. Mejia

records.addlTxt:
Defendant America J. Mejia in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 5.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

  Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction (first 90 days straight time and remainder with Huber), with credit for 4 days served. Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain absolute sobriety with random drug testing.
- Provide a DNA sample. 

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.


*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*Court grants expungement after completion of probation.
*Court does not object to transfer of probation to any intrastate compact state.
*Court does not object to traveling out of state for work.
Received and Filed. Addendum to Plea Questionaire and Waiver of Rights
Branch 4 down. Parties contacted to reschedule. Parties agree upon next court date. Parties notified. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant America J. Mejia in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant America J. Mejia in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  America J. Mejia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant America J. Mejia in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  This hearing will be streamed live on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1U3FddFaQmDrwcXp6sBGNg  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant America J. Mejia in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Defendant America J. Mejia in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  America J. Mejia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
